defs: that has come together; joined.
happened; occured; taken place.
the act of joining, uniting or being joined, united; union.
a coming face to face with; a meeting.
a sexual union; coition.
(astron.) a conjugation of two or more planets in a zodiacal house.
the disorder of the digestive faculty caused by the vitiated windy, bile and phlegm humours.
the act of killing.
a prolonged conflict between two military forces; a war.
the act or practice of observing or keeping a custom, rule, etc.; observance.
to adhere to, follow, keep or abide by (a custom, rule, etc.); to observe.
information about recent and important events; news; tidings.
good behaviour, conduct.
a large gathering of people, animals, etc.; a multitude.
a collection of objects laid on top of each; a heap.
a formal gathering of a number of persons for purpose of discussion, announcement, etc.
a group of persons regarded as forming a single community, esp. as forming a distinct social or economic class; a society.
the system or condition of living together as a community in such a group; a society.
all people, collectively, regarded as constituting a community of related, interdependent individuals; a society.
any organised group of people joined together because of work, interests, etc. in common; a society.
a body of persons organised for some specific purpose, as a club, union or society.
malicious, harmful to or tending to destruct, the society.
a man who or that which destroys or is harmful to the society.
the quality of being destructive, harmful to the society.
a woman who destroys or is harmful to the society.
welfare of society, with a particular emphasis on poor, uneducated, employed sections; social welfare.
= ಸಮಾಜಕಂಟಕ1.
= ಸಮಾಜಕಂಟಕ2.
= ಸಮಾಜಕಂಟಕತನ.
= ಸಮಾಜಕಂಟಕಿ.
a person living together with others harmoniously; a social being.
a person who gets along well with others; a sociable person.
a person who likes to involve himself or herself with friends, loves companionship or sociability; an affable person.
betrayal of trust, faith or allegiance of the society; any action amounting to treachery, perfidy towards the society.
a person who cheats or is trecherous, disloyal to the society.

a theory which advocates the ownership and operation of the means of production and distribution, and also control of capital and land by state rather than by private individuals, with all members of state sharing in the work and the products; socialism.
a follower, advocate or supporter of ಸಮಾಜವಾದ.

the science of human society and of social relations organisation, and change, esp. the study of the beliefs, values, etc. of societal groups and of the processes governing social phenomena; socialogy; social science.
an expert in social science; a social scientist; a socialogist.
= ಸಮಾಜವಿಜ್ಞಾನ.
a man who seeks to bring about social reform and works for it.
a woman who seeks to bring about social reform and works for it.
the act or process of reforming of a society.
the state of a society being reformed.
a man, without being influenced by selfish motives, engaged in social work, esp. in the service of poor, under-privileged, physically handicapped persons, etc.; a social worker.
a woman, without being influenced by selfish motives, engaged in social work, esp. in the service of poor, under-privileged, physically handicapped persons, etc.; a social worker.

any service, wihtout being influenced by selfish motives, for the welfare of society, as providing health, education, recreation, aid for the poor, under-privileged, physically handicapped persons, etc.; social work; social service.
the state or quality of being calm or tranquil; freedom from mental agitation, anxiety, fear, etc.; mental calmness; serenity; tranquility.
the state of being satisfied, pleased; satisfaction; contentment; complacency.
the will or ability to wait or endure without complain; endurance; patience; tolerance.
the act of focussing one's thoughts on a single object; the state of being concentrated; concentration.

ಸಮಾಧಾನಪಡಿಸು samādhāna paḍisu = ಸಮಾಧಾನಿಸು; ಸಮಾಧಾನ ತಂದುಕೊಳ್ಳು samādhāna tandukoḷḷu to console oneself; to overcome one's grief; ಸಮಾಧಾನಮಾಡು samādhāna māḍu = ಸಮಾಧಾನಿಸು; ಸಮಾಧಾನ ಹೇಳು samādhāna hēḷu to speak to make another feel less disappointed, distressed; to console; ಸಮಾಧಾನ ಕೊಡು samādhāna koḍu to give satisfaction to; to satisfy; ಸಮಾಧಾನ ಕೇಳು samādhāna kēḷu to seek or demand explanation for (esp. reasons for doing or not doing something); ಸಮಾಧಾನಪಡು samādhāna paḍu to feel satisfied; to be content with.
